body_html:
I checked the log, and found that scikit-learn (>= 0.19) has not been deploy in CI environments.

tensorflow/contrib/metrics/python/ops/metric_ops_test.py:6799: [E1123(unexpected-keyword-arg), CohenKappaTest.testWeighted] Unexpected keyword argument 'sample_weight' in function call

Because sklearn.metrics.cohen_kappa_score has supported sample_weight from 0.19 (August 12, 2017), and the function is necessary to check weights of cohen_kappa we proposed. So could we upgrade the scikit-learn dependency?

tensorflow/contrib/metrics/python/ops/metric_ops_test.py:6799: [E1123(unexpected-keyword-arg), CohenKappaTest.testWeighted] Unexpected keyword argument 'sample_weight' in function call
Because sklearn.metrics.cohen_kappa_score has supported sample_weight from 0.19 (August 12, 2017), and the function is necessary to check weights of cohen_kappa we proposed. So could we upgrade the scikit-learn dependency?
body:
I checked the log, and found that scikit-learn (>= 0.19) has not been deploy in CI environments.
```bash
tensorflow/contrib/metrics/python/ops/metric_ops_test.py:6799: [E1123(unexpected-keyword-arg), CohenKappaTest.testWeighted] Unexpected keyword argument 'sample_weight' in function call
```

Because `sklearn.metrics.cohen_kappa_score` has supported `sample_weight` from 0.19 (August 12, 2017), and the function is necessary to check `weights` of `cohen_kappa` we proposed. So could we upgrade the scikit-learn dependency?
